update.description:
Note: This model requires a custom ros\_ign\_bridge to be built \(or our latest PR for ros\_ign\_bridge to be incorporated\). Instructions for where to find the source code can be found in “submitted\_models/marble\_hd2\_sensor\_config\_1/BuildingCustomRosIgnBridgeForMarble.txt”

See [specifications.md](http://specifications.md) file for more information

Sensors:

* camera\_front \(based on Intel RealSense D435\)

    * 1280 x 720 resolution
    * Depth range of 10m to 0.1m
    * 30 fps
    * 86 degree Horizontal FOV and 57 degree vertical FOV
    * Topics: vehicle\_name/front\_facing/image\_raw & vehicle\_name/front\_facing/depth & vehicle\_name/front\_facing\_rgbd\_camera/depth/points & vehicle\_name/front\_facing/etc…
    
* camera\_down \(based on Intel RealSense D435\)

    * Same specifications as camera\_front
    * Topics: vehicle\_name/front\_down/image\_raw & vehicle\_name/front\_down/depth & vehicle\_name/front\_down\_rgbd\_camera/depth/points & vehicle\_name/front\_down/etc…
    
* camera\_pan\_tilt \(based on Intel RealSense D435\)

    * Same specifications as camera\_front and camera\_down
    * Topics: vehicle\_name/pan\_tilt/image\_raw & vehicle\_name/pan\_tilt/depth & vehicle\_name/pan\_tilt\_rgbd\_camera/depth/points & vehicle\_name/pan\_tilt/etc…
    
* planar\_laser \(Based off RPLidar S1\)

    * 10 hz
    * 920 horizontal samples
    * 360 degree horizontal range
    * 0.04m to 25m range
    * 3cm resolution
    * Topics: vehicle\_name/planar\_laser\_scan
    
* front\_laser \(Based off OS1-64 Laser in 20x1024 configuration\)

    * 1024 horizontal samples
    * 360 degree horizontal range
    * 64 vertical samples
    * 45 degree vertical range
    * 0.09m to 120m range
    * 1cm resolution
    * Topics: vehicle\_name/points
    
* IMU \(Based off Lord Microstrain 3DM-GX5-25 IMU\)

    * `https://www.microstrain.com/sites/default/files/applications/files/3dm-gx5-25_datasheet_8400-0093_rev_n.pdf`
    
* Pan-Tilt Gimbal

    * Pan range: -180 to 180 degrees
    * Tilt Range: -160 to 160 degrees
    * Topics: vehicle\_name/pan\_tilt/pan\_rate\_cmd\_double & vehicle\_name/pan\_tilt/tilt\_rate\_cmd\_double
    

‌

content.raw:
We are migrating this repository to github on April 10th due to [Bitbucket's forthcoming termination of Mercurial]( https://bitbucket.org/blog/sunsetting-mercurial-support-in-bitbucket). We need to close all open pull requests in order to cleanly move this repository to github.

Could you please target this pull request to the [model_pr_427 branch](#!/osrf/subt/branch/model_pr_427)? 

We will merge this pull request on April 8th to the `model_pr_427` branch, complete the migration to github by April 10th, and open a new pull request for this model.

Thank you for the submission and help with our migration.
content.html:
We are migrating this repository to github on April 10th due to Bitbucket's forthcoming termination of Mercurial. We need to close all open pull requests in order to cleanly move this repository to github.

Could you please target this pull request to the model_pr_427 branch?

We will merge this pull request on April 8th to the model_pr_427 branch, complete the migration to github by April 10th, and open a new pull request for this model.

Thank you for the submission and help with our migration.

content.raw: Ah so there are default values that were set too high. Thanks for noticing that and for suggesting the fix. I will implement a change right now.

pull_request.title: Model Submission for Marble HD2 sensor configuration 1

pullrequest.title: Model Submission for Marble HD2 sensor configuration 1

content.raw:
The gimbal is nice.  In the current version, the vehicle moves when the gimbal starts and stops.  I tested setting the inertias of the gimbal links \(pan\_gimbal\_link, tilt\_gimbal\_link\) to small values and it resolves this issue.  The inertias added were just guesses at small values.  Adding the following inertias after the <mass> 0.1 </mass>  is what I tried:

```
    <inertia>
      <ixx>0.00001</ixx>
      <ixy>0</ixy>
      <ixz>0</ixz>
      <iyy>0.00001</iyy>
      <iyz>0</iyz>
      <izz>0.00001</izz>
    </inertia>
```

‌
content.html:
The gimbal is nice. In the current version, the vehicle moves when the gimbal starts and stops. I tested setting the inertias of the gimbal links (pan_gimbal_link, tilt_gimbal_link) to small values and it resolves this issue. The inertias added were just guesses at small values. Adding the following inertias after the <mass> 0.1 </mass> is what I tried:

    <inertia>
      <ixx>0.00001</ixx>
      <ixy>0</ixy>
      <ixz>0</ixz>
      <iyy>0.00001</iyy>
      <iyz>0</iyz>
      <izz>0.00001</izz>
    </inertia>

‌
